text.tspan: Quantizer
Free
Modular

tspan.tspan: A quantizer rounds arbitrary control voltages to the closest option in a predefined scale. This lets you
keep things musical by constraining the output of an LFO, random voltage generator, or even a
sequencer to a given musical scale or even just a few notes. This module has two quantization channels
which can operate on the same or different scales. It takes 1V/octave signals in and, after rounding,
transposing, and some other processing. outputs 1V/octave signals again.
Each of the 12 note buttons has an alternate function, indicated by an icon. These functions can be
accessed by holding down Shift while pressing the button. The functions are as follows:

text.tspan: Rotate counterclockwise/transpose down - translates the whole scale down by

tspan.tspan: semitone. This does not directly transpose the input or output; it only changes what
are available in the scale to quantize to.

text.tspan: Rotate clockwise/transpose up - translates the whole scale up by one semitone.
Menu
Glide/portamento - determines the length of the transition between notes. Continue

tspan.tspan: holding down Shift after pressing this button. Then press any of the 12 buttons to select a
glide amount, starting at C = 0 and increasing clockwise. The LEDs will indicate the selected
amount as long as you hold the Shift button.

text.tspan: Trigger delay - determines how long to wait after a note before outputting a trigger. Can

tspan.tspan: be set in the same way as glide.

text.tspan: Track/Sample toggle - Sets the behavior of the sample input. In track mode, the

tspan.tspan: functions like a track-and-hold, continuously updating the output as long as the
gate is held high (this also works with no gate input since it is normalled high). In
mode, the module functions like a sample-and-hold, only sampling the input once
rising edge of the sample gate input (this will stop the module from doing anything
a sample trigger input). Just click this button once to toggle between modes. The
briefly indicate the new value (green for track, red for sample).

text.tspan: Post shift - Transposes the output up or down by a number of semitones. This happens

tspan.tspan: after all quantization; it is equivalent to changing the tuning of your oscillator. Note that
this cannot exceed the 0-10V output range, so it may be clipped. Dial in the shift amount in
the same way as glide; continue holding down the shift button and press any button to set
the level. Negative (counterclockwise) values are indicated in red, positive (clockwise)

text.tspan: Scale shift - Transposes the note up or down a number of degrees in the scale.
Pre shift - Applies a given voltage offset (in 1V/oct semitones) to the input before

tspan.tspan: quantization. Depending on the scale, this will sometimes have no effect on the output.

text.tspan: Relative pitch toggle - When off, channels A and B are completely independent. When

tspan.tspan: the input to channel B's quantizer is the sum of CV inputs A and B.

text.tspan: Channels linked toggle - When off, channels A and B have separate scales and

tspan.tspan: When on, channels A and B use the same configuration; only the inputs are
orthogonal to relative pitch mode. You can use either, both, or neither.

text.tspan: Select channel A - Both channels are always working, but the menu will only show and

tspan.tspan: effect the selected channel. When channel A is selected, selected notes will be green and
the active note will be amber. Does nothing when channels are linked

text.tspan: Select channel B - Selected notes will be red and the active note will be amber.

text.tspan: Sample gate input
